channel.title: Raviraja's Blog
channel.description: Blogs about Deep Learning and NLP

item.title: MLOps Basics [Week 6]: CI/CD - GitHub Actions
item.description: We might have to share our application with others, and when they try to run the app most of the time it doesn’t run due to dependencies / OS related issues. Let's see how to solve this problem using Docker.
item.author: raviraja.ghanta@gmail.com (Raviraja Ganta)

item.title: MLOps Basics [Week 5]: Model Packaging - Docker
item.description: We might have to share our application with others, and when they try to run the app most of the time it doesn’t run due to dependencies / OS related issues. Let's see how to solve this problem using Docker.
item.author: raviraja.ghanta@gmail.com (Raviraja Ganta)

item.title: MLOps Basics [Week 4]: Model Packaging - ONNX
item.description: Models can be built using any machine learning framework available out there (sklearn, tensorflow, pytorch, etc.). We might want to run in a different framework (trained in pytorch, inference in tensorflow). A common file format will help a lot. In this post, let's see how to do this using ONNX.
item.author: raviraja.ghanta@gmail.com (Raviraja Ganta)

item.title: MLOps Basics [Week 3]: Data Version Control - DVC
item.description: Classical code version control systems are not designed to handle large files, which make cloning and storing the history impractical. Which are very common in Machine Learning. In this post, let's see how to use DVC for doing version controlling of models and data.
item.author: raviraja.ghanta@gmail.com (Raviraja Ganta)

item.title: MLOps Basics [Week 2]: Configurations - Hydra
item.description: Configuration management is a necessary for managing complex software systems. Lack of configuration management can cause serious problems with reliability, uptime, and the ability to scale a system. In this post, let's see how to use Hydra tool for doing that.
item.author: raviraja.ghanta@gmail.com (Raviraja Ganta)

item.title: MLOps Basics [Week 1]: Model Monitoring - Weights and Bias
item.description: Tracking all the experiments like tweaking hyper-parameters, trying different models to test their performance and seeing the connection between model and the input data will help in developing a better model. In this post, let's see how to use Weights and Bias tool for doing all that.
item.author: raviraja.ghanta@gmail.com (Raviraja Ganta)

item.title: MLOps Basics [Week 0]: Project Setup
item.description: The goal of the series is to understand the basics of MLOps (model building, monitoring, configurations, testing, packaging, deployment, cicd). As a first step, Let's setup the project.
item.author: raviraja.ghanta@gmail.com (Raviraja Ganta)
